body_html:
I can confirm that the hack works to copy the python 3.5-installed tensorflow packages from site-packages, and copy it back into python 3.6 after hex-editing the pywrap_tensorflow_internal.pyd, to change python35->python36 .

Still it would be great if this package was kept current, a lot of people do want to use Windows platform but it's very hard to make a cohesive environment when different ML packages are only working under pythonX.X or pythonY.Y

body:
I can confirm that the hack works to copy the python 3.5-installed tensorflow packages from site-packages, and copy it back into python 3.6 after hex-editing the pywrap_tensorflow_internal.pyd, to change python35->python36 .

Still it would be great if this package was kept current, a lot of people do want to use Windows platform but it's very hard to make a cohesive environment when different ML packages are only working under pythonX.X or pythonY.Y
